intro: Lastrea rigida, commonly known as the rigid lastrea, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers during the summer months, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in arid gardens.
